company.name: Thru, Inc.
company.business_description: Thru, Inc. provides cloud-based file transfer software.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

complaint.factual_background: Thru, Inc., a cloud-based file transfer software company, falsely claimed on its website that it complied with the EU-U.S. and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks. Although the company initiated an application for Privacy Shield certification in June 2017, it never completed the necessary steps to participate in either framework, yet continued to represent that it complied with these frameworks in its privacy policy.

representations_made.description: Claimed to comply with the EU-U.S. and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks
representations_made.quoted_text: Thru Inc., complies with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework as set forth by the U.S. Department of Commerce regarding the collection, use, and retention of personal information transferred from the European Union and Switzerland to the United States.

counts.title: Privacy Misrepresentation
counts.representation: Respondent represents that it is a participant in the EU-U.S and the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks
counts.fact: Respondent was never certified to participate in either the EU-U.S. or the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 11 is false or misleading.

definitions.Respondent: Thru, Inc., a corporation, and its successors and assigns.

provisions.title: Prohibition against Misrepresentations about Participation in or Compliance with Privacy Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent participation in or compliance with privacy or security programs, including but not limited to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework and the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield framework
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that Respondent and its officers, agents, employees, and attorneys, and all other persons in active concert or participation with any of them, who receive actual notice of this Order, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which Respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including but not limited to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework and the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield framework.

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit acknowledgment of receipt of the Order to the Commission and deliver copies of the Order to specified personnel, obtaining signed acknowledgments from each recipient.

requirements.description: Submit acknowledgment of receipt of Order to the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent, within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

requirements.description: For twenty years after issuance, deliver a copy of the Order to all principals, officers, directors, LLC managers and members, employees with managerial responsibilities for conduct related to the subject matter, agents and representatives who participate in conduct related to the subject matter, and any business entity resulting from any change in structure
requirements.quoted_text: For twenty (20) years after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all employees having managerial responsibilities for conduct related to the subject matter of the Order and all agents and representatives who participate in conduct related to the subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in structure as set forth in the Provision titled Compliance Report and Notices. Delivery must occur within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order for current personnel. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.

requirements.description: Obtain signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of Order from each individual or entity to which Order was delivered
requirements.quoted_text: From each individual or entity to which Respondent delivered a copy of this Order, Respondent must obtain, within thirty (30) days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit compliance reports and notices to the Commission, including an initial compliance report within sixty days and notices of any changes in structure, contact information, or bankruptcy proceedings.

requirements.description: Submit initial compliance report identifying designated points of contact, all of Respondent's businesses and their details, activities of each business, compliance with each provision of the Order, and copies of acknowledgments obtained
requirements.quoted_text: Sixty (60) days after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury, in which Respondent must: (a) identify the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission, may use to communicate with Respondent; (b) identify all of Respondent's businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (c) describe the activities of each business; (d) describe in detail whether and how Respondent is in compliance with each Provision of this Order; and (e) provide a copy of each Acknowledgment of the Order obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: Submit compliance notice within fourteen days of any change in designated point of contact or structure of Respondent or any entity that Respondent has ownership interest in or controls that may affect compliance obligations
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within fourteen (14) days of any change in the following: (1) any designated point of contact; or (2)the structure of Respondent or any entity that Respondent has any ownership interest in or controls directly or indirectly that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Submit notice of filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding within fourteen days of its filing
requirements.quoted_text: Respondent must submit notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Respondent within fourteen (14) days of its filing.

requirements.description: All submissions to the Commission required by the Order must be sworn under penalty of perjury and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746
requirements.quoted_text: Any submission to the Commission required by this Order to be sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, such as by concluding: "I declare under penalty of perjury under the laws of the United States of America that the foregoing is true and correct. Executed on: _____" and supplying the date, signatory's full name, title (if applicable), and signature.

requirements.description: Unless otherwise directed, all submissions to the Commission must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier to the Associate Director of Enforcement
requirements.quoted_text: Unless otherwise directed by a Commission representative in writing, all submissions to the Commission pursuant to this Order must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier (not the U.S. Postal Service) to: Associate Director of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Washington, D.C. 20580. The subject line must begin: In re Thru, Inc., FTC File No. 1823196, Docket No. C-4702.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specified records for twenty years after issuance, retaining each record for five years, including accounting records, personnel records, compliance records, and copies of representations subject to the Order.

requirements.description: Create and retain accounting records showing revenues from all goods or services sold
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Respondent must create certain records for twenty (20) years after the issuance date of the Order, and retain each such record for five (5) years. Specifically, Respondent must create and retain the following records: A. accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold;

requirements.description: Create and retain personnel records showing name, addresses, telephone numbers, job title or position, dates of service, and reason for termination for each person providing services
requirements.quoted_text: personnel records showing, for each person providing services, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person's: name; addresses; telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and (if applicable) the reason for termination;

requirements.description: Create and retain all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of the Order, including all submissions to the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission;

requirements.description: Create and retain a copy of each widely disseminated representation by Respondent making any representation subject to the Order, and all materials that were relied upon in making the representation
requirements.quoted_text: a copy of each widely disseminated representation by Respondent making any representation subject to this Order, and all materials that were relied upon in making the representation.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission has authority to monitor Respondent's compliance, including requesting additional reports, inspecting records, interviewing personnel, and using undercover methods to verify compliance.

requirements.description: Within ten days of receipt of written request from Commission representative, submit additional compliance reports or other requested information and produce records for inspection and copying
requirements.quoted_text: Within ten (10) days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission, Respondent must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury, and produce records for inspection and copying.

requirements.description: Permit representatives of the Commission to communicate directly with Respondent and interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview
requirements.quoted_text: For matters concerning this Order, representatives of the Commission are authorized to communicate directly with Respondent. Respondent must permit representatives of the Commission to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview. The interviewee may have counsel present.

requirements.description: Allow the Commission to use all lawful means, including undercover methods, to verify compliance with the Order
requirements.quoted_text: The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing through its representatives as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, to Respondent or any individual or entity affiliated with Respondent, without the necessity of identification or prior notice. Nothing in this Order limits the Commission's lawful use of compulsory process, pursuant to Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-1.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is final and effective upon publication on the Commission's website and will terminate on January 13, 2040, or twenty years from the most recent date that a complaint is filed in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later.

requirements.description: Order becomes final and effective upon publication on the Commission's website (ftc.gov)
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission's website (ftc.gov) as a final order.

duration.termination_text: This Order will terminate on January 13, 2040, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision. Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that Respondent did not violate any provision of the Order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the Order will terminate according to this Provision as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the Order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.
